Steps to stop severe bleeding: 1. Calm the patient and lay them flat. 2. Reassure the patient to prevent fear. 3. Loosen clothes around neck/waist for easy breathing. 4. Raise the bleeding part to reduce blood flow. 5. Raise the foot of the bed to increase blood flow to the brain and prevent fainting.
Fainting is a temporary loss of consciousness where a person loses touch with their surroundings. It may occur due to insufficient supply of air or blood to the brain.
